title: Tuto Quarto-Reveal.js
text:
Metadata
The metadata of the current document is shown at the top of the page

preview-links: true : view in current window. Try it
transition: slide : choose transmition mode
chalkboard: true : activate chalkboard
controls: true : show navigation arrows

title: Lesson 1
text:
1 First part

1.1 Tabulations

CodePlotData




file.py

import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

np.random.seed(42)
pairs = np.random.rand(10, 2)

plt.scatter(pairs[:, 0], pairs[:, 1], color='blue', alpha=0.7)
plt.show()





Code

plt.scatter(pairs[:, 0], pairs[:, 1], color='blue', alpha=0.7)
plt.show()

1.2 Code

import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
from scipy.stats import norm

x = np.linspace(-5, 5, 1000)

pdf = norm.pdf(x, 0, 1)
plt.plot(x, pdf, label='Normal Distribution')
plt.show()

library(ggplot2)
ggplot(mtcars, aes(hp, mpg, color = am)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(formula = y ~ x, method = "loess")

title: Code Python dans les slides
text:
Python

Utiliser Python
installer Python
installer jupyter
pip install numpy
pip install matplotlib

title: Code Python dans les slides
text:
Code python

import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

r = np.arange(0, 2, 0.01)
theta = 2 * np.pi * r
fig, ax = plt.subplots(subplot_kw={"projection": "polar"})
ax.plot(theta, r)
ax.set_rticks([0.5, 1, 1.5, 2])
ax.grid(True)
plt.show()
